questiontext.text:
Here is the graph of a quartic:

[[jsxgraph width='250px' height='250px']] JXG.Options.axis.ticks.majorHeight = 10; JXG.Options.axis.ticks.insertTicks = false; JXG.Options.axis.ticks.ticksDistance = 200; JXG.Options.text.fontSize = 16; var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard(divid, {boundingbox: {#BB#}, axis: true, showCopyright: false, showNavigation:false}); var f = board.jc.snippet('{#q#}', true, 'x', true); board.create('functiongraph', [f,{#BB[1]#},{#BB[3]#}],{strokeColor:'#003399',strokeWidth:2}); var xaxis = board.create('axis', [[0,0],[1,0]]); board.create('ticks', [xaxis, {#[a1,b1,c1]#}], {strokeColor: '#003399', majorHeight:15, drawLabels: true, label: { offset: [0, -10],anchorX: 'middle', anchorY: 'top' }}); var yaxis = board.create('axis', [[0,0],[0,1]]); board.create('ticks', [yaxis, {#[y0]#}], {strokeColor: '#003399', majorHeight:15, drawLabels: true, label: { offset: [-10, 0],anchorX: 'right', anchorY: 'middle' }}); [[/jsxgraph]]

(a) Which of the following is the correct form for the quartic equation shown in the graph?

[[input:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]] [[validation:ans1]]

(b) What is the value of \(k\)?

      \(k=\) [[input:ans2]][[feedback:prt2]] [[validation:ans2]]

generalfeedback.text:
(a) The graph cuts the \(x\)-axis at \(x={@b1@}\) and \(x={@c1@}\) so the factorised form of the quartic will have single factors of \(({@x-b1@})\) and \(({@x-c1@})\).

The graph has a repeated root at \(x={@a1@}\) so there will also be a factor of \({@(x-a1)^2@}\).

So the quartic has the form \(y={@qform_withabc@}\) for some value of \(k\).

(b) Since the quartic graph passes through the point \((0,{@y0@})\), we have

\[ {@y0@}={@(ev(qform_withabc,[x=0])),simp=false@}={@keqn@} \]

Thus \(k={@k1@}\).

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.
